intro: Bungarimba papuana, commonly known as the Papuan bungarimba, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its hairy, palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
